attributes.action: Stop the new development of 850 Houses in Leighton (Cheshire)
attributes.additional_details: Please Stop the development of 850 homes! That works out at appx 1700 cars, and appx 3400+ people! This area is already crowded. The hospital is already over flowing and bursting at the seams. The traffic situation is already an issue with the massive number of cars and with Pyms Lane being closed, causes more congestion. This new housing development will do nothing for Leighton, and will only cause issues and spoil ‘Crewe’s Countryside’.
attributes.background: There will be a new development of 850 homes on ex-farmland. Crewe is already overcrowded, and hasn’t got the capacity to deal with the homes. Also Leighton is known for it’s farm/green land and by building on it is ruining its name.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Local planning decisions are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban developments on Green belt and Greenfield sites across the country:https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/600577

Ban development on agricultural land to increase food self-sufficiency: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611113
